It'd be great if WeakEventHandlerManager was public, I've recently used it to make an CompositeConnected, similar to CompositeCommand but for an IConnected interface (for backend connectivity). Also for custom commands where DelegateCommand or CompositeCommand isn't suitable. I currently want to have a ConnectedDelegateCommand, its purpose would be to add some backend connection changed logic to a command.canexecute. Its proving hard as DelegateCommand<T>.canExecuteMethod is private, thus i need to derive (and cant access WeakEventHandlerManager).

Comments.Message:
I am upgrading from CAG for WPF 1.0 to latest Prism 4.X.
I am relying heavily on this MSDN document http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff921144(v=pandp.40).aspx#sec4, one thing I can't figure out is this WeakEventHandlerManager does not seem to exist in the new assemblies.
How should we handle this moving forward?
I found the reason, WeakEventHandlerManager  is now an internal static class in Prism 4 which used to be public static class. This is a bummer! It would be nice to know the reason for this change.
